label: 聖
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Saint translates hijiri, a term used of hermit monks, wandering ascetics, and popular preachers.  Such men often carried horn-tipped staffs, used berries for prayer beads, and dressed in deerskins (p. 343n).
